Key initiatives include health observatories in eight states to combat diseases, community-managed tribal creches, and sports hubs in schools. The budget also focuses on employment generation, malnutrition, and infrastructure development in remote areas, while preserving tribal culture.

items.title: EY, PwC ‘Chinese Walls’ under spotlight amid insider trading allegations
items.summary: Allegations of insider trading against EY and PwC partners in India have raised concerns about the effectiveness of 'Chinese walls' and internal controls within professional services firms. These firms' deep involvement in deal-making, including IPOs and M&As, creates risks of price-sensitive information leakage.

items.title: Chicago grain prices fall amid profit-taking and dollar rebound
items.summary: GLOBAL-GRAINS/ (UPDATE 2):GRAINS-Chicago grain prices fall amid profit-taking and dollar rebound

items.title: Budget 2026: Full coverage on ET Now
items.summary: Get ready for an in-depth analysis of Budget 2026 with ET NOW! Join us Sunday, February 1, starting at 7 am for preliminary insights before the Finance Minister takes the stage at 11 am. Our lineup of financial experts, including the insightful Swaminathan S Anklesaria Aiyar, will interpret the crucial announcements and fiscal strategies unfolding throughout the day.

items.title: New viability gap funding in the works for energy storage
items.summary: A new governmental initiative is on the horizon, focused on establishing a funding scheme to enhance energy storage viability. Designed to fortify grid stability and promote the swift integration of renewable resources, this plan encompasses both pumped storage projects and advanced battery systems.

items.title: Fiscal deficit at 54.5% of FY26 target at Dec end
items.summary: Positive news on government finances—by December, the fiscal deficit has shrunk to 54.5% of its annual goal. This achievement is primarily driven by robust net tax collections and a healthy increase in total receipts. Meanwhile, revenue expenditure has been kept in check, and capital investments have surged.

items.title: RRBs told to expand agri & MSME loans
items.summary: In a bold stride towards economic empowerment, Regional Rural Banks are ramping up their financial support for agriculture and small enterprises. This initiative comes on the heels of a notable surge in net profits, coupled with an impressive capital to risk-weighted assets ratio, showcasing their financial resilience and commitment to fostering growth in rural landscapes.

items.title: Carney, Macklem Congratulate Warsh on Federal Reserve Nomination
items.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem congratulated Kevin Warsh on his nomination to lead the Federal Reserve.

items.title: 'Recent FTAs to give India's exports a meaningful boost', says chief economic advisor
items.summary: With high US tariffs hopefully behind us, India's net FDI inflows are set to surge. Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran predicts a promising rise in private investment for FY25. The upcoming free trade agreements are anticipated to greatly enhance merchandise exports. Emphasizing growth, the idea of an 'entrepreneurial state' promotes decisions that prioritize tangible development outcomes.

items.title: Essar Oil & Gas to invest $100 million to expand Raniganj CBM output
items.summary: The proposed investment marks the next phase of development at Raniganj East, where EOGEPL currently produces around 1 million standard cubic metres per day (MMSCMD) of natural gas, making it the largest CBM-producing block in India.

items.title: Budget may unveil plan to transform PSBs
items.summary: In a bold move towards economic revitalization, the government is preparing to launch a groundbreaking initiative aimed at revamping public sector banks. This strategic plan is a cornerstone of the ambitious Viksit Bharat 2047 vision, aspiring to position these banks among the top 20 globally competitive financial institutions.

items.title: Binance Founder Zhao Fends Off Crypto Market Crash Accusations
items.summary: Changpeng “CZ” Zhao, co-founder and former chief executive officer of Binance, said lingering accusations that the world’s largest digital asset platform bears responsibility for the crypto market crash last October are “far-fetched.”

items.title: World Bank to offer $8-10b annually for 5 years to fuel India's growth, jobs
items.summary: In an ambitious move, the World Bank Group has committed to funneling $8-10 billion each year into India over the next five years. This groundbreaking partnership pivots around enhancing job creation through the private sector.

items.title: Weekly rest for pilots must, no airline given exemption: DGCA to HC amid FDTL dispute
items.summary: Pilot duty rules: Sabari Roy Lenka, a former aircraft engineer, had moved the high court claiming that the regulator didn't have the authority to keep the rules in abeyance and, therefore, they must come into force immediately. The rules were meant to improve "fatigue management" of pilots, said Lenka.

items.title: Airtel Africa reports 24% profit jump to $210 million in December quarter

Automatic train protection system Kavach commissioned on 472-km route: Indian Railways

This expansion across three key sections, including Vadodara-Virar, enhances operational safety and reliability on high-density routes. The system's effectiveness was validated through a successful head-on collision test.

items.title: Sebi opens one-year special window for transfer and dematerialisation of physical securities

Sebi has opened a special one-year window, from February 5, 2026, to February 4, 2027, allowing them to transfer and dematerialise shares that faced procedural or documentation issues before the April 2019 mandate. This initiative aims to resolve long-standing grievances and grant rightful access to these assets.

items.title: Gold loans grow fastest among all major bank credit segments: RBI

Sebi removes letter of confirmation requirement, allows direct credit of securities to demat accounts
items.summary: The Securities and Exchange Board of India, SEBI, is simplifying investment processes. A Letter of Confirmation for credit of securities will no longer be required. Instead, securities will be directly credited to investors' demat accounts. This change aims to speed up the process significantly. The new system will be effective from April 2, 2026.

He highlighted that a customer's monthly income of Rs 40,000 makes even small price changes significant. However, rising fuel and rental costs could diminish these gains. Rupee devaluation is also a concern for sustained demand.

The government and LIC aim to sell 60.7% of the lender, with the successful bidder gaining naming rights.
